question: Can mitochondria transfer from cell to cell?
ideal_answer:
Yes,
the recently discovered phenomenon of mitochondrial transfer between mammalian cells has gained momentum since it was first described in cell culture systems more than a decade ago.

snippets.text: Interest in the recently discovered phenomenon of mitochondrial transfer between mammalian cells has gained momentum since it was first described in cell culture systems more than a decade ago.
We show evidence that mitochondria transfer from Jurkat cells to MSCs, which is mediated by cell adhesion
This process of mitochondria transfer is mediated by tunneling nanotubes, which are protrusions that extend from the cell membrane .
